title: How to watch and live stream Liège-Bastogne-Liège 2023
content:
Cyclist
How to watch and live stream Liège-Bastogne-Liège 2023

The final Monument of spring 2023, Liège-Bastogne-Liège, takes place on Sunday 23rd April and will be broadcast live on Eurosport and GCN+ in the UK and Europe, Flobikes in the USA and Canada, SBS in Australia and Sky in New Zealand.

Also known as La Doyenne, it’s the oldest Monument, with the men’s race first held in 1892 and the women’s race added in 2017. It wraps up the Ardennes week before the week-long stage races become the main focus of attention in the run-up to the Giro d’Italia.

The men’s race is run over 258.5km and the women’s race over 140km, with the climax of both coming on the final climbs of La Redoute and the Côte de la Roche aux Faucons.

In 2022 the men’s race was won from a long-range break by Remco Evenepoel, who broke free from the peloton on La Redoute and bridged to race leader Bruno Amirail of Groupama-FDJ before ditching him on the Roche aux Faucons to win by 48 seconds from the chasing group led in by Quinten Hermans and Wout van Aert. The women’s race was won by Annemiek van Vleuten, who powered away from the favourites on the Roche aux Faucons to win by 43 seconds.

How to watch Liège-Bastogne-Liège 2023

Liège-Bastogne-Liège takes place on Sunday 23rd April 2023 and there is a range of options to catch the action live and on demand, depending on where you live. The men’s race starts at 10:15 CET and is slated to end at around 16:55 CET while the women’s race starts at 08:35 CET with a finish estimated from 12:18 CET.

Discovery+ is covering the men’s and women’s races live and on demand in the UK, Australia and other territories in Europe via Eurosport and GCN+.

UK pricing for a GCN+ subscription is £6.99 a month or £39.99 per year. The online platform is accessible on desktop and mobile, offering uninterrupted live coverage and longer broadcasts than the television. GCN+ is ad-free, gives commentary choices and also provides cycling-based documentaries to watch. The races will also be available to watch back in full on GCN+ if you miss the action, and you can choose to watch from the start even if you join halfway through.

The Discovery+ Entertainment & Sports pass costs £6.99 a month or £59.99 a year, and you’ll get the same coverage as GCN+ plus access to the platform’s other content including celebrated highlights including Wheeler Dealers and Spooked Scotland.

In the USA and Canada, coverage is on Flobikes and starts at 07:30 Eastern Time for the men’s race and 05:15 Eastern Time for the women’s race. There’s on-demand coverage available too. In New Zealand, coverage of the men’s and women’s races is on Sky.

If you live outside the above countries, you may still be able to catch the race on GCN+. A full list of races covered by each country is available on globalcyclingnetwork.com.

If you’re unable to watch via a streaming service, there will be free highlights of both races on GCN Racing and Eurosport channels.

Liège-Bastogne-Liège 2023 TV and streaming times

Women’s race

Eurosport 1: 10:15-12:00
GCN+: 10:15-12:00

Men’s race

Eurosport 1: 10:15-12:00
GCN+: 12:00-16:30

Times may be subject to change by broadcasters
